DataElement.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Cancer AJCC Edition 8 Pathologic Regional Lymph Node N Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Extent of the regional lymph node involvement for head and neck cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma based on clinical stage information combined with operative findings, and evidence obtained from pathology review when surgery is the first definitive therapy, using AJCC Ed. 8 criteria.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Head and Neck Tumor Pathology N Stage
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information related to the pathologic N stage, the extent of lymph node invasion of a malignant neoplasm based on pathologic evaluation of a tissue specimen, of a malignant neoplasm originating in the head and neck.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: For oncology, area of the body generally construed to comprise base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.:(NEE-o-PLAY-zha) Abnormal and uncontrolled cell growth.

Concepts.definition: For oncology, an area of the body generally construed to comprise the base of skull and facial bones, sinuses, orbits, salivary glands, oral cavity, oropharynx, larynx, thyroid, facial and neck musculature and lymph nodes draining these areas.

A benign or malignant tissue growth resulting from uncontrolled cell proliferation. Benign neoplastic cells resemble normal cells without exhibiting significant cytologic atypia, while malignant cells exhibit overt signs such as dysplastic features, atypical mitotic figures, necrosis, nuclear pleomorphism, and anaplasia. Representative examples of benign neoplasms include papillomas, cystadenomas, and lipomas; malignant neoplasms include carcinomas, sarcomas, lymphomas, and leukemias.

Property.preferredDefinition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.:One criteria of the TMN staging system.  N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

Concepts.definition: The medical science, and specialty practice, concerned with all aspects of disease, but with special reference to the essential nature, causes, and development of abnormal conditions, as well as the structural and functional changes that result from the disease processes. Informally used to mean the result of such an examination.
One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the process of identifying a disease by the signs and symptoms (NCI Glossary).

DataElementConcept.changeDescription: 6/29/21 TL Changed RS to Qualified. 6/23/21 TL received permission from Brian Campbell to transfer ownership from CTEP to NCI Standards; AK.   Changed the Property to point to NCIt concept

ValueDomain.preferredName: Head and Neck Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma American Joint Committee on Cancer Pathologic N Category
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A pathologic finding about one or more characteristics of cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck, following the rules of the TNM AJCC v8 classification system._A group formed for the purpose of developing a system of clinical staging for cancer that is acceptable to the American medical profession and is compatible with other accepted classifications._One criteria of the TNM staging system. N refers to the extent of lymph node involvement._A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pNX TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pNX TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pNX TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck in which the regional lymph nodes cannot be assessed.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral lymph nodes, any with ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral lymph nodes, any with ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral lymph nodes, any with ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN3 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a lymph node larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral, contralateral, or bilateral lymph nodes, any with ENE(+). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2c TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2c TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2c TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2b TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2b TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2b TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2a TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2a TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral or contralateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2a TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral or contralateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-). (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN2 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(+); or metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node larger than 3 cm but not larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in multiple ipsilateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-); or metastases in bilateral or contralateral lymph nodes, none larger than 6 cm in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN1 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.longName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN1 TNM Finding v8
Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck with metastasis in a single ipsilateral lymph node, 3 cm or smaller in greatest dimension and ENE(-).  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN0 TNM Finding v8

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Cutaneous Squamous Cell Carcinoma of the Head and Neck pN0 TNM Finding v8
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck without metastasis in the regional lymph nodes.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)

Concepts.definition: Cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma of the head and neck without metastasis in the regional lymph nodes.  (from AJCC 8th Ed.)
